supporting_text: The TOR of the AMR committee is recommended to include: Purpose: Adapt a ONE health approach to ensure all relevant sectors and stakeholders are engaged and contributing to the implementation of activities as outlined in the National Action Plan on AMR.
Goal 4.1: Promote the rational use of antimicrobials in human health through the implementation of the National Medicines Policy 2022 in relation to AMR containment.
Goal 4.3: Promote the rational use of antimicrobials for animal health.
Goal 2.5: Encourage communication across AMR surveillance system human, animal and environment sectors.
Goal 3.5: Promote Vaccination programs in commercial farms (Good Farm Practices - GFP).

The National AMR committee will report directly to the Director General of Health; co-chairs will be the Deputy Director General of Public Health and the Deputy Director General of Hospital and Clinical Services.
The implementation of activities will take a staged approach over the life of the National Action Plan.
The document does not specify quantitative targets for AMR prevalence and antimicrobial use.
The management of the overall budget and implementation of the Samoa's National AMR Action Plan will be the responsibility of the Ministry of Health.
The National AMR Committee will develop a Costing and M&E framework to assist in submitting for annual budgetary requirements linked to harmonize results-based M&E Framework.
The National AMR Committee will be responsible for the implementation of the Samoa's National Action Plan on Antimicrobial Resistance.
Revise a legal framework/policy to ensure inclusion of a legal provision for Nurse Practitioners/Senior Nurse Specialists to prescribe a pre-defined list of antibiotics.
Incorporation of AMR component into medical curriculum at NUS and OUM.
Goal 1.1: To develop evidence-based awareness campaign for general public, consumers, prescribers and all stakeholders on AMR.
Samoa has made Antimicrobial Resistance a priority agenda for the Health Sector with the establishment of an AMR Committee as well as the development of National Antibiotic Guidelines.
Goal 2.1: To strengthen laboratory capacity for AMR surveillance and research.
Conduct training to improve appropriate antibiotic prescription in animals.
Goal 3.1: Improve hygiene and sanitation practices in the community and healthcare settings.
The inclusion of all national stakeholders in the discussion and the finalisation of Samoa's National Action Plan on AMR is very important.
Ensure biennial updating and distribution of Essential Medicines List (EML) to relevant stakeholders.
Goal 4.1: Promote the rational use of antimicrobials in human health through the implementation of the National Medicines Policy 2022 in relation to AMR containment.
The document does not specify participation in international collaborative research.
